atom 1.0.2 download from release atom-mac.zip and install.

when I first open atom it comes to a untitled txt file,then choose a local folder and open it ,then close editor and reopen,it come to a untitled again.

add project folder does not work either
2. from the terminal, try to use atom . from a local folder, and close the editor manually by clicking the "x" icon ，also i try to open two local folders and shutdown one of them and reopen editor again, it won`t work either

data.title: Project Folder Sidebar text
data.body: When opening a large project folder and scrolling down or up, the project folder sidebar text becomes unreadable in some parts. Clicking near the text artifacts clears it up in that area, but opening the preferences pane clears it temporarily for that session. Atom version: 1.0.2 OS X 10.10.4

data.title: Unable to auto update on OS X 10.10.3
data.body:
Trying to upgrade from 1.0.0 to 1.0.2.

10/07/15 16:27:14,748 Atom[23703]: App load time: 675ms
10/07/15 16:27:51,981 Atom[23703]: Download completed to: file:///Users/jeffwilliams/Library/Application%20Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt/update.BVNKFkF/download

I choose "Restart and Install Update".

Atom closes and never restarts. When I restart manually it is still version 1.0.0.

I ended up manually copying Library/Application\ Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt/update.BVNKFkF/Atom.app to /Applications, which seemed to work fine.

I had a similar issue with upgrading to 1.0.0 and downloaded from the website and installed.

data.title: Atom crashes when a firefox tab is moved over it
data.body:

[16948:0710/080707:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(170)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.

The program 'atom' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadAtom (invalid Atom parameter)'.

   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.

data.title: tree-view identation
Ask before loading previous project
data.body:
Hi

At the moment, Atom loads the last project worked on when you launch it. Which is great, except when you want to work on something else and your previous project has a substantial size. It takes some time to load, then you have to open a new window via the menu and close the old one. 

It would be really awesome if we could get some splash to choose what we want to open:
- Last project
- Recent projects
- New project
- Open folder / file

Because for people who switch between multiple projects it's frustrating to have to wait for project X to load before you can close it and begin to load project Y.

data.title: Atom hangs after startup
data.body:
When starting Atom on Windows7 - 65 bit without having a windows I can see the icon in my task bar. Unfortunately I cannot open the Atom-Window. INstead of this I see the waiting cursor from Windows and nothing happens. 
Preview-Windows from window when hovering over task-icon shows me the preview of the Atom-window. 

We are using a proxy, but I haven't configured it right now. Maybe Atom waits for any kind of timeout?

What can I do? I am using version 0.22.3.0.

data.title: Atom on ARM Information
data.body:
_Hi :wave: This issue is an informational issue about the state of running Atom on computers with ARM processors (like those in Raspberry Pis and some Chromebooks)._

---

**Atom does not _effectively_ work on ARM** (July 9th, 2015)

![atom-10-launch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1305617/8609239/94cbf112-2657-11e5-8381-d6b5c74e6bd7.png)

It does, however, now _build_ and _launch_ on ARM (see image above from ARM Chromebook). This is due to the fact that [Electron](http://github.com/atom/electron), as of `v0.29.0` now builds an [ARM compatible distribution](https://github.com/atom/electron/releases/tag/v0.29.0) :sparkles: (as an aside, this is really, really great news for future applications and tinkerers). But the latest versions of Electron use a newer version of Chrome and have not been tested against Atom which [currently uses](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/package.json#L15) `v.22.3` of Electron (at this time Electron was still named Atom-Shell). Typing and clicking don't work at all and/or trigger lots of exception notifications and render the application pretty useless. This could be because of the new Electron compatibility issues, but we can't be quite sure as we don't really know yet what those issues are. 

**What will it take to get there?**

These errors will have to be sorted out and fixed. This is not on any roadmap right now and could be a lot of work (patches welcome! :raised_hands:). Getting Atom upgraded to the latest Electron will help answer this question but it's not there just yet (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6877). 

It's worth noting that  even if Atom were on the latest Electron, you will still need to build it yourself because it requires some other adjustments (see below). 

**Want to try it out?**

Maybe it will _just work_ on your machine! I have a [gist with the steps](https://gist.github.com/jlord/7ffaf94d041982346934) to build. It involves using forks of both apm (Atom's package manager) and Atom so that you can build apm with [io.js](https://iojs.org) instead of Node.js since the later does not support ARM.

data.title: Uncaught BufferedProcessError: Failed to spawn command `/usr/local/share/atom/atom`. Make sure `/usr/local/share/atom/atom` is installed and on your PATH
data.body:
I've built atom v1.0.0 from src on linux 64-bit.

After install, 'atom' launch script is in $PATH

```
    which atom
        /usr/local/bin/atom
    ls -al \
     /usr/local/bin/atom \
     /usr/local/share/atom/atom
        -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 root    root  2.7K Jul  9 15:44 /usr/local/bin/atom*
        -rwxr-xr-x+ 1 root    root   11M Jul  9 15:44 /usr/local/share/atom/atom*
    file \
     /usr/local/bin/atom \
     /usr/local/share/atom/atom
        /usr/local/bin/atom:        Bourne-Again shell script, ASCII text executable
        /usr/local/share/atom/atom: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked (uses shared libs), for GNU/Linux 2.6.24, BuildID[sha1]=176e777a52b1683e73d2eb69527b98ddaebc5e6f, stripped
    atom --version
        1.0.0-3874576
```

On launch, atom functions normally.

However, when, and only if, I open the developer console, I see this ERROR

```
    Uncaught BufferedProcessError: Failed to spawn command `/usr/local/share/atom/atom`. Make sure `/usr/local/share/atom/atom` is installed and on your PATH
```

data.title: Atom package documentation web page should handle relative image URLs.
data.body:
Github supports relative URLs for things like images in markdown files. The Atom generated package docs do not.

For example compare these:

https://atom.io/packages/nuclide-flow

And:

https://github.com/facebook/nuclide/tree/master/pkg/nuclide/flow

The relative image URLs work in the github page, but not the Atom page.

data.title: Reloading the window when project folders are open fails
data.body: Running version 1.0.2 I realized that reloading Atom in full screen mode causes the application to just remain black. Reload only works if the app is taken out of full screen mode first. Is this behavior expected?

data.title: Autocomplete multi-edit shouldn't create new word
Atom window closes but processes still running
data.body:
Hey,
I do not know what happened. I used some shortcuts and then atom closed itself. When I tried to open it nothing happened so I had a look at processes. And Atom was still running. I closed all of them and started Atom again. I could see the window for 1-2 seconds but the window closed again and the processes are still running. I would like to restart my computer but i can't right now because I got some important programs running right now.
Is there a way to reset the settings or something else so that I do not have to install everything again?

Update1:
So I reinstalled Atom. Still cannot use it. Always closing itself :(

Update2:
So, I could "fix" it the hard way. I deleted all installed Packages. the whole caches etc.
This mean:
C:\Users\xxx.atom\storage
C:\Users\xxx.atom\packages
C:\Users\xxx.atom\compile-cache
C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Atom

There need to be some tool that directly clear the cache etc. if something like this happens. Would be cool if you can use it like this 
C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\atom\update.exe --clear-cache [--processStart] atom.exe

data.title: Fuzzy Finder does not respect "Ignored Names"
data.body: Unlike "Find->Find in Project" which respects "Core Settings->Ignored Names", "Find->Find FIle" does not but presents all files in the open projects.

data.title: More consistency checks for DisplayBuffer and TokenizedBuffer
data.body:
I'm trying to hunt down these uncaught exceptions that seem to derive from corrupted states. This PR seasons in some additional checks to help us track where things go wrong.
- An assertion whenever we update screen lines that the count matches the buffer if there are no folds or soft wraps. This should help us see the moment this goes wrong if it does.
- The inclusion of change counts in exception metadata. Every time the buffer changes, we'll increment a count. When the tokenized buffer and display buffer process these changes, we'll assign their change counts to match. If these numbers ever differ, it means we haven't processed a change between two layers.

data.title: Update message
data.body:
Hi and thanks for a great tool! 

I was just thinking, it would be nice if there was an update message on the "Updates" page in settings so that one can see what has changed since last version and decide to update that package or not.. I guess that also means that the package developers has to take the time to write this message. It's kind of scary to update packages without having any clue to what will change...

Keep up the good work!

data.title: Cannot open files or folders on Mac OS X El Capitan beta
data.body:
You cannot open a file or folder on Mac OS X El Capitan. This has been the case with the first, second and current third developer release.

Also, after opening the file dialog, cancel does not close it. Command Q does, then Command Q to close Atom. 

Interestingly, Visual Studio Code, built on the same Electron code base, runs perfectly fine on these builds of Mac OS X El Capitan.

data.title: Release Notes can't update
data.body:

How Can I update Atom Release Notes.
thank you very much

data.title: Move view registration for Pane & Gutter related views earlier
data.body: Registering them in pane-container led to packages deserializing before e.g. Gutter was available.

data.title: Ignore NaN coordinates passed to workspace.open
data.body:
Generally, I want an exception to be thrown when packages try to put markers at invalid positions: it's a problem in the package. But in the case of calling `Workspace::open` with an `initialLine` or `initialColumn`, the stack trace doesn't include the package, because the method is async. It also seems like it's not a big deal to ignore these parameters if they're something that's not a number, like `NaN`.

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7398
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7672

data.title: Auto Hide Menu Bar does not reveal on trigger, Win 8.1
data.body:
Atom 1.0.0, Win 8.1 x64

When the setting is checked/toggled on, I can only trigger reveal of the menu bar via `alt` on a tab such as 'Settings', on any of my code tabs pressing `alt` does nothing. Is it also intended to hide when focus changes rather than waiting on `alt` key again?

If there is a way for me to backup/snapshot my current installation of Atom with packages/settings that I can later restore, I could try verify the issue still exists on a fresh install. My monitor also has 166dpi, I've noticed the menu bar lacks vertical whitespace, it's packed rather tightly against the text, if there is a way to add some vertical padding or adjust the menu bars height that'd be good too :)
